title: 'Indian Gateway' exhibition goes on show in Leicester | Central
text:
A new exhibition exploring the relationship with Gujarat, Mumbai and Britain over four centuries opens in Leicester today.
One of the photos in the exhibition Credit: Tim Smith The 'India's Gateway' exhibition will be at the New Walk Museum for four months, and it features photographs and film shot in India by photographer Tim Smith, and Indian film-makers Amit Madheshiya and Shirley Abraham.
The art is accompanied by personal stories to explore the history of the trade and migration between the places, and the lives and experiences of Gujerati communities today.
The art goes alongside personal stories on the relationship between Britain and Mumbai Credit: Tim Smith From food, film and fashion to trade and industry, interest in India is booming, and Gujarat and Mumbai are leading the way.
The exhibition is inspired by the region's vibration mix of cultures, and how that mix has been shaped by a rich history of trade, seafaring, migration and its close connections with Britain.
It's been fantastic to work with many different communities, here and in India, and lots of people have contributed their ideas and stories.
– Tim Smith, photographer British Indian tourists taken by the exhibiting photographer Credit: Tim Smith Leicester City Council's museum service has also been working to add more to the exhibition, with objects, photos and artwork from local people that will exhibited alongside the touring show.
This fascinating touring exhibition has been given a unique local perspective thanks to the community volunteers who have been working with our museums teams.
– Cllr Piara Singh Clair, Leicester City Council Last updated Sat 17 Oct 2015 Entertainment Leicester
